items.title: Escalating in frequency, duration or severity
First-degree relative with known premature (men aged <55 years; women <60 years) coronary or vascular disease
First-degree relative with known LDL-C above the 95th percentile
First-degree relative with tendinous xanthomata and/or arcus cornealis, or children aged <18 years with LDL-C above the 95th percentile
Close contact within 14 days of symptom onset

items.heading: Focus on the most abnormal auscultation foci
items.title: Heart murmur

Chronic Heart Failure with Known Etiology
At High Risk for HF, but wthout Structural Heart Disease or Symptoms of HF NYHA/CCVS Class 0
